"So a Michael Government appoints people who aren't teachers to set targets; those same people then attack schools for being too target-driven; and a new regime sets new targets to break the spell of the old targets. It would be more interesting, productive- and cheaper- to reform Ofsted, so that it drew its inspectors from among the best of the active teaching population. The` target' problem would probably solve itself.
